pr_title: SOLR-14223 PublicKeyHandler consumes a lot of entropy during tests

timeline.bodyText: This must not be static or shared across test instances. A better solution would be to create this off an initial long seed and this seed should be taken from RandomizedContext.current..().random().nextLong().
timeline.author: dweiss

+  private static final Random RAND = new Random(42);

replies.bodyText: Hmm, not sure how that would work. Not every test runs with RandomizedContext, and even for those that do according to the code "static test class initializers are not permitted to access random contexts"
replies.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: If the concern is that the random seeds are not reproducible across test runs... nothing using SecureRandom right now is reproducible anyway by design, so this wouldn't be a regression.
replies.author: madrob

replies.bodyText:
All tests should extend from LuceneTestCase. If they don't, it's likely a problem already (because this also dodges thread leak checks, etc.). As for static variables - don't make it a static instance (it wasn't before if I see the diff right). Static instances make the reasoning about tests a lot more difficult and order-dependent.
bq. "static test class initializers are not permitted to access random contexts"
Correct. Because this happens outside of the control of the test runner. Again - it makes reasoning about leaked threads (and anything else) more difficult.
replies.author: dweiss
